results.title: Como
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Looks at the National Trust property, Como, giving a description of the buildings and a brief history. Built prior to 1851, it was the home of the Armitage family until acquisition by the National Trust. Script by Glenn Berry.

results.title: Commutativity
results.brief_description: Uses animation, appropriate sound effects and narration to explain the principles of commutativity. Demonstrates that addition is commutative but subtraction is not. Stresses use of commutative property to make learning of addition facts easier.

results.title: Community theatre
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art and Environment”.
The term “community theatre” covers a wide spectrum of groups which reject the normal relationship between audience and actors. They act in factories, schools, at meetings, in the street, performing for people who normally would not go to the theatre.

results.title: Community service
results.brief_description: Film uses two PMG trainee staff as a link to the various activities which take place at the Seventh World Rover Moot at Yarra Brae, Victoria, in January 1962, attended by 1000 rovers from fifteen nations. Countries represented included Sweden, Ceylon, Japan, Papua and Canada. The painted tents of the Canadians depict how they travelled to the moot to join in the many tasks, games, tours and service activities undertaken during the fortnight. The spontaneous songs, the final ceremony and church service shows the fun of rover scout activities and the fine spirit of community service developed.

results.title: Community life, women and the Temple of Karnak
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer focuses on the role of women in ancient Egypt and their rituals such as birthing practices as well as reading some Egyptian love poetry. Romer explains the mathematical perfection of the Great Temple of Karnak, and provides an insight into the workings of the village oracle, the supernatural and medical treatment.

results.title: Community in quest
results.creator_credit: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman
results.brief_description: Depicts the political realities that can prevent much needed drug programs from operating in a town. In this film the city leaders are frightened when their traditional values are threatened by unknown methods and they react negatively to a drug program which utilises sensitivity and role playing techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman
